channel.title: Maddy Goodman's Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content on Maddy Goodman's Portfolio

item.title: Does Steven Spielberg really beat Tim Burton in IMDB ratings?
item.description: IMDB is an online database of information related to films, television programs, home videos, video games, and streaming content online – including cast, production crew and personal biographies, plot summaries, trivia, ratings, and fan and critical reviews. Utilising IMDB data, I want to determe whether Steven Spielberg or Tim Burton has a higher mean rating. To do this, I have constructed visualisations and ran a hypothesis test.

item.title: How Political Affiliation Translated to Brexit Voting
item.description: Utilizing the ggplot2 package in R, I built a graph to visualise the effects of political affiliation on leave share percentage, which is the percent of votes cast in favour of Brexit, or leaving the EU. The data is grouped by parliament constituency, and the source can be found at the bottom of this page. We can draw a few different insights from this graph. The most noticeable conclusion we can draw is the UKIP’s strong support of Brexit, whiich we can see from the strong correlation.

item.title: Singapore Airbnb Analytics
item.description: Introduction Airbnb is a vacation rental online marketplace based in San Francisco, California. Founded in 2008, the company has skyrocketed in popularity, with a private valuation of $18 billion and a plan to potentially go public within the year. The scope of this work, is to analyse data about Airbnb listings and fit a model to predict the total cost for two people staying 4 nights in an AirBnB in Singapore.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.
